instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1708: What is A1708? A1708 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2017, 2016 with EMC 3164, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00840, 820-00875..
definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - graphics drivers not loaded?
threads.message:
Hi there, I've got an <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2017 on my desk with a bit strange issue. Originally there was the keyboard fault (some keys did not work) so I have replaced the keyboard and it started to work. I did not see it before, but now this computer acts like the graphics drivers are not loaded - there is no transparency and when you open any window and try to drag it left and right quickly it does not move smoothly but is lagging a bit. Mac OS is Monterey but I tried Catalina and Big Sur and it's all the same. All voltages seem to be correct (compared to the other logic board), no visible signs of spillage (checked under microscope). How to proceed with the repair?

EDIT: I just found that the camera does not provide any picture - green LED is on but picture inside Photo Booth is black. Is it because the graphics drivers are not loaded or maybe it's something which causes the main issue? Can faulty camera prevent the OS from loading GPU drivers?

EDIT 2: I've ruled out all the external parts (screen, keyboard, battery etc). This is definitely the logic board problem.

EDIT 3: I found on the fully working logic board that <SIGNAL>PPVCCGT_S0G</SIGNAL> is 0V when on idle and turns on when GPU is loaded, and on the faulty logic board this voltage is always on (0.45V).

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - graphics drivers not loaded?
threads.message:
iGPU voltage should only appear when high graphics load is detected.
Definetely the graphics is not managed good on the board.
Is the graphics correctly recognized on system report?
Look there for camera too.

Did you try another BIOS?
Any liquid sign?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - graphics drivers not loaded?
threads.message:
Faulty CPU - after replacement everything is fine.
NOTE: after CPU full reflow it started to work for a while (around 2 hours) then failed to load GPU driver and came back to the original fault. Reflow can only be the way of diagnosis for CPU fault, which must be replaced anyway in order to get the logic board permanently fixed.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - graphics drivers not loaded?
threads.message:
Thanks for feedback.
Camera works normall too now?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1708</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A - graphics drivers not loaded?
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 87033, member: 682"]

Yes, camera works perfectly fine.
